qas.question: How does Alaska finance its state government operations?
How many states in the US do not have sales tax?
How many US states do not collect an individual income tax?
Which state has the lowest tax burden of the entire US?

context: To finance state government operations, <a3_0><b8_0>Alaska<b8_0/><a3_0/> depends primarily on <a0_0><b4_0>petroleum revenues and federal subsidies<b4_0/><a0_0/>. This allows it to have the lowest individual tax burden in the United States. It is one of <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>five<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> states with no state sales tax, one of <a2_0><b7_0>seven<b7_0/><a2_0/> states that do not levy an individual income tax, and one of the two states that has neither. The Department of Revenue Tax Division reports regularly on the state's revenue sources. The Department also issues an annual summary of its operations, including new state laws that directly affect the tax division.
